intro: Fissistigma litseifolium, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a glossy surface and serrated edges. Fissistigma litseifolium is often found in coastal and lowland areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
